wood.name: Slabs Slabs Slabs!!! - Live Edge Wood Slabs
wood.description: Eric Christopher Art Sustainably Salvaged Live Edge Wood Slabs & Burlwood   Eric Christopher is on a mission to recycle. Reducing the carbon footprint of society by recycling usable bay area trees. Keeping these beautiful specimens out of the landfills helps combat massive sequestered carbon entering our atmosphere. Displaying respect for our ancestors, and preserving Mother Nature’s artwork for future generations to enjoy! This is why we call these “second life logs” .We are addicted to STACKING!We have hundreds of live edge wood slabs available SML, MED, LRG, XL, & XXL sizes. Our  Bay area & Sonoma County inventory is constantly changing! The creative possibilities are endless!Salvaged Live Edge Wood Slab Species:-Acacia -Ash-Cedar-Claro Walnut-Cottonwood-Cypress-Elm-Ironbark Eucalyptus -Maple-Redwood -SycamoreCommon Uses-Bar Top-Benches -Coffee Table -Console Table-Countertop -Desk -Doors-Dinning Table-End Tables-Garden Art-Headboard  -Mantels-Media Console -Mirror Frames-Nightstands-Patio Table-River Table-Shelving -Tabletops-Vanity-Wall Art                           What It’s All About  The equity you gain from creating your own wood slab heirloom is not something that can be measured on a scale but it is something you can definitely feel. We can walk you through the entire process. First timers no need to be anxious, this is supposed to be FUN. The #1 comment customers say is “Wow it wasn’t as hard as I thought, I’m glad you told me to try it”   We aren’t in the furniture business. We are in the heirloom conversation piece business. Each and every wood slab is unique in it’s own way. Our job is complete when we here a “bing” and see a photo come through of you standing proudly by your masterpiece. We don’t call it quits when you drive away from our facility.  My heart is full of gratitude as I continue reflect on the salvaged material we have provided to our customers over the years. Thank you to everyone that has consciously chosen to purchase the foundation of their project from us . My partners and I invest so much heart into recycling mother nature’s artwork and it is an indescribable feeling to have you guys recognize both the beauty and the effort put forth to give these logs a second life. It is so special for us to be a part of your story. Making the decision to spend your hard earned money on something we worked tirelessly to provide is not something we take lightly or for granted. We appreciate you! STACK EM’ UP!!-Eric Christopher                            Process1. Decide on a project2. Measure the designated available space, keeping in mind the sizes of other nearby objects. Keeping things proportional will help your space feel sophisticated & curated rather than out of place or overbearing.3. Come Look! The fun begins here! Everyone’s taste is different so it’s best to complete steps 1 & 2 and then come look at our inventory and see if anything screams “Take me home” Our inventory is constantly changing. I tell customers “our store is like a shoe store. We don’t always have every size/model/color but it might be tomorrow that we bring the desired material in. Our inventory is based on the trees we are able to give a second life to, not the “click of a button” reorder.4. Price is based on many factors as each boule is unique in it’s own way and each boule is in a different state of its life. The main factors we consider are:-Size (board foot aka volume of material)-Species -Figure-Moisture content-Raw or SurfacedOnce Home 1. Decide on the aesthetic look you want to achieve. Do you want the piece to be rustic or lean towards a clean “scuplted” look?2.Remove the bark. We like to use a “cats paw” and a mallet, working pieces off as large as possible. For hardwoods a draw knife works well.3.Sand, scuplt, and clean-up the edges (if that follows suit towards your desired look. ) If a rustic look is desired you may wish to leave the edge as is.  4.Sand the top & bottom. We generally start at 60 grit, working our way through the grits until at least 400 grit. THIS IS NOT a requirement, just our preference. The higher grits do not only make the wood fibers smoother, they allow the true beauty of the wood to expose itself. The 3D figure is more pronounced and shows a higher level of visual contrast. Some figured woods we sand 1200+ grit. THE FINISH YOU CHOOSE MAY DICTATE WHAT GRIT YOU STOP SANDING AT. Some finish brands call for designated end points wich are usually lower in grit than our preference of 400 grit. Many require a max of 220 grit. Read manufactures directions to see if they specify. Once sanded up to 100 grit we like to then cut ends to size if needed, then continue sanding working our way up through the grits. We sand a bit before cutting to size because it makes for less friction on the saw, which usually helps make a smooth, clean cut.We blow off the slab with compressed air and wipe the entire slab with a tac cloth to remove loose dust, prepping the slab for its finish stage.For more information Contactphone  Website: www.EricChristopherArt.comemail Eric@ErichChristopherArtFb @EricChristopherArtIg @EricChristopherArtAddress:5325 Gravenstein Highway NorthSebastopol, CA 95472

beaded.name: Corello Brazilian Lamb Leather Beaded Hobo Paisley Shoulder Bag Purse
beaded.description: This is a new, with store tag attached, purse by the Brazilian brand Corello. It features a fabric paisley exterior covered in various seed beads and a few iridescent sequins in orange, fuchsia, greens, aqua, lavender, and powder blue. The handles and interior zip pocket opening are taupe lamb leather while the interior is a ribbed ivory fabric. The purse has a single magnetic closure.It measures approximately 10 tall x 14 wide with an 8 handle drop. The tag appears to have a handwritten date of June 11th, 2005 (Brazil's date format of DD/MM/YY).Please call, text, or email anytime.Thank you,Ed

loud.name: Mackie Onyx 1220
loud.description: MACKIE ONYX 1220 12-channel (4 mic input) Premium Analog Mixer w/Perkins EQ and Firewire Option.  (NOTE: this is NOT the later 1220i)Excellent condition.  Purchased used, in new condition, in 2012.  Was in home studio (no smokin) service until 2016.  In storage since.A scan from the owners manual, displayed here, shows how Mackie defines it as a 12 channel mixer.Includes padded Gig Skinz carry bag and Mackie dust cover.Includes optional 96kHz FireWire card that was originally available for streaming 14 independent channels of audio to computer.  Since Mackie stopped supporting drivers, it may or may NOT have that functionality on a Mac.  Definitely not on a Windows platform as of the last time I contacted Mackie in 2016.From Mackie: The Mackie Onyx 1220 12-Channel Mixer is a small-format analog mixer. Includes 4 boutique-class Onyx mic preamps with 3-band Perkins EQ plus sweepable mids on mic/line channels. . . .Includes aux sends with pre/post switches, 4 stereo line-level inputs, a talkback section for use with internal or external mics, true hardware EQ bypass, and a Planet-Earth switching power supply for worldwide use. Other features include individual 48V phantom power switches on all mic inputs; 60mm logarithmic taper faders for smooth, linear fades; and balanced direct outs for every channel via DB-25 connections. Selectable instrument inputs on the first 2 channels means no DI boxes are needed.Features    4 mic inputs    4 stereo line-level inputs    2 aux sends    Built-in Talkback section for use with internal or external mic    True hardware EQ bypass    Planet-Earth switching power supply for worldwide use    Individual 48V phantom power switches on all mic inputs    60mm Logarithmic Taper faders for smooth, linear fades    Balanced direct outs for every channel via DB-25 connections    Selectable Instrument inputs on first 2 channels - no DI box needed    17.3in/439mm H x 13.9in/353mm W x 5.9in/150mm DManual and schematics are posted on the Mackie site.  https://loudaudio.netx.net/portals/loud-public/#search/exact/onyx%201220 .Email correspondence through Craigslist Relay ONLY. -- REPEAT Craigslist Relay ONLY! Thank you kindly.

loud.name: Eastman PCH1-OM Acoustic guitar NEW
loud.description: Selling NEW Eastman PCH1-OM. Solid top, open pore finish, 1 3/4 nut and comfortable C shape neck, amazing craftmanship, perfect intonation, loud and vibrant instrument, soft case included. The guitar sounds and plays better than guitars twice the price!Asking $320, cash.

famous.name: Famous FS-1 Soprano Ukulele OBO
famous.description: Pretty little soprano, nice build with super-thin mahogany laminate, but with a sound that will rival most sold-wood ukes. Extremely light, with excellent projection and beautiful resonance. The FS-1 is a Japanese build, identical to the Kiwaya KS-1, but sold only to the Japanese market. This older uke has a Rosewood fingerboard, which you won't find in production any longer...the newer ones are walnut.  Nice, low action and great intonation. Friction tuners. Tiny scratch on the headstock, mark on the first fret - see the photos for detail. One-of-a-kind cloth gig bag included. Reasonable offers are welcome.

famous.name: Ventura V-1300G Archtop Electric Guitar ES-175 Style-70’s Lawsuit Era
famous.description: This guitar is a 1970’s Japanese knockoff of a Gibson ES-175. These are among those known as “lawsuit guitars,” vintage instruments from that era that were well-made copies of famous American guitars.The pickups in it are humbuckers from a more recent Les Paul. (The knobs are also from a newer Gibson.) It’s a versatile instrument, plays well, and looks great. There is visual evidence of some cracks in the face, which I’ve highlighted in a couple of the photos. None seems to propagate through the face, and given that this is a plywood instrument, they don’t appear to pose any serious problem to the integrity of the guitar.It comes with a nice hard case. If you are looking for a good jazz guitar, but aren’t prepared to spend the thousands that they typically cost, this is a great alternative.I can’t take trades, please don’t offer.

famous.name: Ceriatone C-Wreck Guitar Amplifier
famous.description: Selling in mint condition my Ceriatone C-Wreck Guitar Amplifier.Original design is based on a Brad Paisley Dr. Z build. Very FAST and transparent EL84 cathode biased amp. Beautiful harmonic distortion without NFB. No tradesThe Ceriatone TW series represents our take on yet another famous, rare amplifier line from the United States.The Ceriatone C-Wreck is heavily inspired by an interesting collaboration between the builder of the aforementioned line and another great modern American amp builder.  In topology, it has many similarities to the Rock It!, however we feel this is a further refinement of the design.  The C-Wreck offers a slightly different feel and perhaps an even more satisfying overdriven tone.  As with the Rock It!, the clean and mildly overdriven tones are second to none.Like the other amplifiers from this builder, much of the brilliance in the design is in its simplicity and no-compromises approach to component placement, lead dress, and trying to maintain as unaltered a signal path as possible.  We have kept this approach, but allowed flexibility by offering two different output transformer primary impedances for slightly different feel and harmonic content.Like other Ceriatone amps, we have labored carefully to select the finest components to suit the design, and the Expression uses our specially designed and correct specification custom transformers for superior reliability, frequency response, and feel.Head Dimension : 18.75 x 9.5 x 10.75 inches / Actual Weight : 16kgPower Output	30 WattFeature Overview	Single channelVolume, Treble, Bass, Cut, and Master Volume Controls3-way Bright SwitchHalf Power switch (removes a pair of EL84s and simultaneously rebiases)Fast / Warm Select (selects between high or low plate voltage)Tubes	Power: 4 x EL84Preamp: 3 x 12AX7/ECC83Rectifier: 5AR4 / GZ34#DR Z #Matchless #Vox #Bad Cat #Two Rock #Fender #Marshall #Mesa #Boutique #HiWatt #AC30
